sentence.Network_en: The Sultan was still nominally the Chief of Staff.
sentence.Network_cn: 苏丹仍是名义上的参谋长。

sentence.Network_en: Nominally she is the king's prisoner.
sentence.Network_cn: 名义上她是国王的囚犯。

sentence.Network_en: Dad, nominally a Methodist, entered Churches only for weddings and funerals.
sentence.Network_cn: 爸名义上是卫理公会教徒, 可只去教堂参加婚礼和葬礼.

entry.def: You use nominal to indicate that someone or something is supposed to have a particular identity or status, but in reality does not have it.

example.ex: As he was still not allowed to run a company, his wife became its nominal head...
example.tran: 因为他仍未获准经营公司，他妻子成了名义上的老板。

example.ex: I was brought up a nominal Christian.
example.tran: 我成长为名不副实的基督徒。

entry.tran: (价格或款项)微不足道的，象征性的
entry.def: A nominal price or sum of money is very small in comparison with the real cost or value of the thing that is being bought or sold.

example.ex: I am prepared to sell my shares at a nominal price...
example.tran: 我做好了以极低价格卖掉自己股份的准备。

example.ex: All the ferries carry bicycles free or for a nominal charge.
example.tran: 所有的渡船都免费或以极低的收费运载自行车。

entry.def: In economics, the nominal value, rate, or level of something is the one expressed in terms of current prices or figures, without taking into account general changes in prices that take place over time.

example.ex: Inflation would be lower and so nominal rates would be rather more attractive in real terms...
example.tran: 通货膨胀会更低，因此名义利率换算成实际利率会更具吸引力。

example.ex: In 1990 personal incomes grew a nominal 6.8 per cent.

auth_sentence.content: Kuomintang and Communists nominally unite against Japanese.
auth_sentence.res_content: Kuomintang and Communists nominally unite against Japanese.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kuomintang and Communists nominally unite against Japanese.

auth_sentence.content: It is one of the few countries still under nominally communist rule.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is one of the few countries still under nominally communist rule.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is one of the few countries still under nominally communist rule.

auth_sentence.content: US-based Freedom House says the internet is nominally free from government interference.
auth_sentence.res_content: US-based Freedom House says the internet is nominally free from government interference.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: US-based Freedom House says the internet is nominally free from government interference.

sentences.en: The company could not indicate a person even nominally responsible for staff training.
sentences.cn: 该公司甚至不能指出一个名义上负责职员培训的人。

sentences.en: Dad, nominally a Methodist, entered Churches only for weddings and funerals.
sentences.cn: 爸名义上是卫理公会教徒,可只去教堂参加婚礼和葬礼。
